vlibtour.vlibtour_lobby_room_server

Class VLibTourLobbyServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • vlibtour.vlibtour_lobby_room_server.VLibTourLobbyServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, vlibtour.vlibtour_lobby_room_api.VLibTourLobbyService

    public class VLibTourLobbyServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, vlibtour.vlibtour_lobby_room_api.VLibTourLobbyService
    This class implements the VLibTour lobby room service. This is the entry point of the system for the clients when they want to start a tour.

    When launched in its own process via a java command in shell script, there is no call to close(): the process is killed in the shell script that starts this process. But, the class is a Runnable so that the lobby room server can be integrated in another process.

    Author:
    Denis Conan

      • run

        public void run()
        creates the JSON RPC server and enters into the main loop of the JSON RPC server. The exit to the main loop is done when calling stopLobbyRoom() on the administration server. At the end of this method, the connectivity is closed.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • close

        public void close()
           throws vlibtour.vlibtour_lobby_room_api.InAMQPPartException,

                  java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        calls for the termination of the main loop if not already done and then closes the connection and the channel of this server.
        Throws:
        vlibtour.vlibtour_lobby_room_api.InAMQPPartException - the exception thrown in case of a problem in the AMQP part.
        java.io.IOException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        starts the lobby server.

        When launched in its own process via a java command in shell script, there is no call to close(): the process is killed in the shell script that starts this process.

        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - all the potential problems (since this is a demonstrator, apply the strategy "fail fast").
